comments:
Whenever opening a visual (Swing) class in visual editor, eclipse crashes with
the error message "Error IWAV0138E: Remote VM terminated to soon", followed by a
message saying "Error to set new file in editor", which cannot be clicked away -
eclipse freezes and has to be terminated from the task manager.

probably this is an issue depending on processor power, since this problem does
not occur on my desktop machine, but only on my laptop (1.000 MHz PIII, 512MB
RAM), using the identical eclipse version and settings.

Using VE Build id: 200403251209, but also noticed this in the most recent
integration build.

I can't reproduce this with our latest builds. Please try with the M1RC1 driver
on M8 Eclipse and see if it still occurs. If it does, please reopen the bug.

with M1RC1 it fails silently on my laptop - of course i cannot tell if this is
the same bug. when i open or create a visual class, synchronizing stops after
25% and nothing is displayed in the upper half of the visual editor.

as mentioned before, this only happes on my notebook.
Please attach the .log file so we can see what errors it produced.

Created an attachment (id=10063)
.log file of eclipse session with failed attempt to open visual class

attached a log file of a single session, trying to open a single visual class
in the visual editor. it contains a few line saying

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/ui/PlatformUI
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.beaninfo.adapters.UICreateRegistryJobHandler.processCreateRegistry(UICreateRegistryJobHandler.java:42)

Ah yes! This is an older (i.e. used once already for VE) eclipse configuration
where you unzipped a new VE over top of it, right? We changed abd added a
pre-req to one of the plugins and the old configuration was cached in the
eclipse and it would  not see the new requirement. Had to go to the
eclipse/.config directory and delete the .config directory. That way it will
rebuild the cache and see the new requirement. 

It seems to only see changes like this when you add a new version of a plugin.
It doesn't see that the old version plugin.xml has been modified.

i cannot find any .config directory in my installation - neither in the eclipse
program directory, nor in the workspace.
Sorry, it is configuration directory in the eclipse installation.

ok, i got that to work, but now i see the original bug again. only this time the
error says "IWAV0067E No Standard Bean Type Proxy Factory has been set"

the bad thing is that i cannot click "ok" on this, so i have to kill eclipse
every time this happens.

i will attach the .log file of this session below.

Created an attachment (id=10068)
log file of crash session

this is the original error. there seems to be some problem with our classes
(com.inteligand.*) involved, but still it shouldn't crash so badly. also the
question remains why it works on my desktop machine (same setup)

I see this piece of output coming from your code that we execute:

getClass()class com.inteligand.ilib.config.PathFinder
path/com/inteligand/ilib
getResource()file:/C:/data/projects/ilib/bin/com/inteligand/ilib
Could not load essentials:
C:\data\projects\ilib\bin\com\inteligand\ilib\moldata\essentials\oh.mol (Das
System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden)


And right after this the remote vm is terminated. Do you have a System.exit()
call somewhere in your code when you get this error? If you do, you will
terminate our remote vm where we run the code. It looks it is hitting that. The
file mentioned doesn't exist on your system, so it can't find it.

There were other hard-coded (i.e. looking on the C: drive for them) files, and
they couldn't be found either.

We already have an enhancement requirement to see if we can put in a security
manager which will prevent system.exit() from being called.

I just tested a case where a System.exit() is thrown in the user class. We still
get message about remote vm terminated too soon. It will try three times, after
the third try it gives up. But it doesn't lock up and prevent you from using the
text editor portion. The code in M1RC1 doesn't have the necessary fixes yet to
not lock up. 

The next M1 release should be tried and see if you still lock up. You won't be
able to do anything with the visual part because you are still doing the
System.exit(). But you shouldn't be locking up.

I've released changes to HEAD to get rid of the freeze problems when vm
terminated prematurely. However, I can't stop the premature termination. That is
done in user code.
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
